data.title: Mouse state does not change when trying to resize panels.
data.body:
After tonight's pull of bit changes, when trying to change the panels width or hight be it in inspector, scene, filesystem or edited animation, the panels do resize, but my mouse cursor does not change any more into left-right arrow or up-down arrow, but remains normal/unchanged arrow. 
I don't know if it's related but I have noticed lots of errors in godot running console. Errors that look like:
At: core/object.cpp:1463.
ERROR: disconnect: Disconnecting nonexistent signal 'size_changed', slot: 2221:_size_changed

Every time the number after object.cpp:  was different.

My system is Xubuntu 14.04 LTS 64-bit.

data.title: Ability to preview 2D camera boundaries.
data.body:
Animating the camera is pretty useful to make cutscenes and other cinematic content, but I find there's some trial and error involved (specially when zooming near edges) because of the 2D camera not showing its boundaries.

I'd like to request some way to draw a rectangle matching the parameters of the current 2D camera (rotation, zoom and position), similar to the rectangle marking the viewport boundaries, so you can easily know what's on-screen and what isn't.
That way all the work would be quickly visible from the editor, without having to run the scene for adjustments every time.

data.title: Haiku: fix build and add resource file
data.body: Just fixing the build and adding a resource file with an icon and some metadata.

data.title: Fix 32 bit windows export crash
data.body:
Fixes #2189 and #1868.
I don't know these build warnings were related to this issue or not but after change -O3 compiler option to -O2 they gone:
`scene/libscene.windows.opt.32.a(shader_graph.windows.opt.32.o): duplicate section .data$_ZZN4Math9fast_ftoiEfE1b[__ZZN4Math9fast_ftoiEfE1b]' has different size
servers/libservers.windows.opt.32.a(audio_mixer_sw.windows.opt.32.o): duplicate section .data$_ZZN4Math9fast_ftoiEfE1b[__ZZN4Math9fast_ftoiEfE1b]' has different size`
and 32 bit release Windows export doesn't crash anymore.
Built on ubuntu 14.04 64 bit and tested on windows 7 64 bit.

data.title: Arrow keys and enter don't work anymore in "Quick open" dialog
data.body: @TheHX @neikeq @MarianoGnu

data.title: ERR_COMPILATION_FAILED in the terminal when opening a project using singleton autoloads
data.body:
Though @reduz worked around the issues we were having with singleton autoloads (#3156), there is still a trace of it when you start a project in a terminal:

```
ERROR: GDScript::reload: Compile Error: Identifier not found: my_autoload
   At: res://new_scene.gd:5.
ERROR: reload: Method/Function Failed, returning: ERR_COMPILATION_FAILED
   At: modules/gdscript/gd_script.cpp:1889.
```

It stills works just fine, but this error hints that it's maybe still not 100% clear how such singleton autoloads are initialised.

See this minimal example that reproduces the issue: https://up1.ca/#bE6ZikY3SeEHUt03RM0rRw
Just start it with `godot -e` and you'll see the error in the terminal.

data.title: Add ability to set "keep screen on" for android & iOS. fixes #2428
data.body:
Default value of `Keep Screen On` is `true`
Can change `Keep Screen On` at Project settings.

2 methods are added to `OS`.

```
OS::set_keep_screen_on(bool)
bool OS::is_keep_screen_on()
```

data.title: Add ability to set "keep screen on" for android & iOS. fixes #2428
data.body:
Can change "Set Keep Screen On" at Project settings.

2 methods are added to `OS`.

```
OS::set_keep_screen_on(bool)
bool OS::is_keep_screen_on()
```

data.title: F5 hotkey to refresh FileDialog/EditorFileDialog
data.body:
Related to #1123, but it may not entirely fix the issue (continue reading).

The unhandled input is captured before the EditorNode captures it, so it won't fire run. At least it does so for the file dialogs that are child of EditorNode.
Are the input events spread in a tree way, children before parent? If so, perhaps we should check if a dialog is visible before handling that input in editor node, which I am not sure how to do since:

> _EditorNode_ inherits from _Node_ so it cannot call `Control::window_has_modal_stack()`, and this method is private so it cannot be called on _EditorNode_'s `gui_base`

data.title: Collada files import into Godot with missing geometry (OpenCollada exporter)
data.body:
An FBX file with animation (converted to Collada format using OpenCollada exporter) imports into Godot with part of the geometry missing.

The original FBX file as it looks in 3DSMax:
![colladageometry-06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12352622/e02154fc-bb87-11e5-8515-30b00eb71c7a.png)

The OpenCollada settings used:
![colladageometry-07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12352567/56cc26aa-bb87-11e5-9f9b-5f014292bfa8.png)

The resulting Collada file imported into 3DSMax:
![colladageometry-09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12352605/bd1f7b1e-bb87-11e5-995b-778069703397.png)

The Collada file as it appears after import in Godot:
![colladageometry-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12352631/01a3ad8c-bb88-11e5-968b-a191ee320545.png)

The import settings used in Godot:
![colladageometry-03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12352639/0db60c00-bb88-11e5-97ba-168202e01284.png)

The problem with missing geometry is the same as described in case #3328

data.title: Spatial/Canvas Editor: Ignore unhandled input if there is a dialog
data.body:
Ignore unhandled input if there is a dialog visible. However, I am not sure if there is any other situation where these editors catch this input when they shouldn't.
Fixed #3348

data.title: Write changelog for Godot 2.0
data.body:
A WIP changelog was already started by @Calinou and maybe some others at https://etherpad.net/p/godot-2.0-changelog

This issue is just meant as a reminder for the link, and also to centralize the other issues that require a changelog mention (API breakage, undocumented new feature, etc.).

data.title: Document new scene inheritance concept
data.body:
We need a wiki page about scene inheritance to explain its purpose, how it works and how it should be used. We can then reference it in the changelog for 2.0.

Related to #3352.

data.title: position of LineEdit for changing node name is wrong if using custom Global Font
data.body:
I changed editor font with https://www.google.com/get/noto/ (noto sans CJK regular) at **Editor Settings > Global > Font**

The `LineEdit` position looks wrong when I tried to edit node name.

![lineedit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8281454/12344069/c24db962-bb7c-11e5-95a0-d7624ad5563b.jpg)

tested it on Ubuntu 14.04 and Windows 7 with 698b338bc8e98d98a0ba903b06f8db55855e4cfb commit.

it does not happen always, some of scenes are fine, some not.

data.title: When scene is empty an "instance scene" icon, should show a hint on how to create inherited scene
data.body:
**Current info about this issue** is basically inside this comment: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3352#issuecomment-171688699

---

When empty scene is opened, some people would generally want to use inheritance scene feature but they are not aware of the fact that it's under Scene->New Inherited scene. They are trying to click + sign above the scene tree tab, and because it's dimmed, it looks like it's impossible to create new scene with root from the different scene. 
![inheritancescenehint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/12328843/988a1dd6-badd-11e5-9d38-36fb9813e171.png)
**I think that the '+' should not be dimmed so much in this case, and after click there should be dialog popup with text something like: _"To create inherited scene you need to click Scene->New inherited scene"_**

As a side note: Some might think it would be good to remove Scene->New inherited scene, and put this functionality under '+' sign when scene tree is empty. I don't think it's a good idea since Inherited Scenes works slightly different then regular scene instancing, and the fact that it's creation is putted somewhere else might be good indicator of that (and hint for users to check documentation on how exactly it's working).

It would be ideal to have this in 2.0 since this is first stable with this functionality.

data.title: Fix LineEdit not capturing text input events
data.body:
Regression from #3269 a825cfd
Fixes #3348

data.title: Project manager search is hiding all the projects

Search in project manager is not working, it hides all the projects and the only way to see them again is to restart Godot.
![pmsearchnotworking](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/12324985/49ac8fd4-bac7-11e5-8ba3-c2a227e382b0.gif)

data.title: Add custom graph nodes to graph shader editor using plugins.
data.body:
I think it would be useful if the shader editor in godot could have some premade nodes like a panner to allow quickly to do animated textures (like river flowing, lava etc).

The input would be:

> uv map (the uv map of the object)
> x (the intensity of the animation in u coordinate)
> y (the intensity of the animation in v coordinate)
> time

and the output would be an animated uv coordinate

I made a screenshot explaining the idea
![panner](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6406045/12323632/61942756-babd-11e5-9d33-6157d3f55ece.png)

Thinking in a generic way, it would be very useful to be able to create node group and being able to export them. Which means even if we wouldn't have the panner we could easily create our own groups and sharing them.

data.title: select mode is changed to another when 2d or 3d viewport is not focused.
data.body:
reproduce steps.
1. create a node
2. make editable node name by double click
3. try to change name to `qwe`

this will change select mode to another continuously

edit : I found it happens also when 2d or 3d viewport is not focused

data.title: Add Modifier keys left/right support
data.body:
The thing is, in Godot the modifier keys **SHIFT, CTRL, ALT/OPTION and WINDOWS** keys for
both the left and right side are considered as the same key. Pressing left CTRL should be different
than pressing the right CTRL. Same for the other modifier keys. In Godot, left and right modifier keys share the same scancode.

From my experience with DirectInput in DirectX, it can be done. although Godot does not use DI.

Also, provide an option to disable propagating the **WINDOWS** key event to the OS, when Godot window is focused. Again, it can be done in DirectInput but don't know how Godot deals with Input. Currently, when I set up an action to use the windows key in game, when pressing it the start menu pops up.

data.title: Quaternion uniform assignment.
data.body: Fixes a bug which prevents shader vec4 uniforms from assigned to by quaternion types. They originally only worked with plane types. Fixing this should avoid some unnecessary confusion.

data.title: Removed GDScript "function" keyword
data.body: Removed the "function" keyword from GDScript, it's a alias for "func".

data.title: Ability to hide  panel with scripts
data.body:
Minimal horizontal size for  panel with scripts was = 70, changed it to 0.
It's especially helpful if someone is working on a laptop, or just don't like to have anything on the left side of the screen.
Video  that shows how it's working after the change: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y_o4pOpjyhY&feature=youtu.be

data.title: Godot editor does not work with El Capitan dual full screen feature
data.body:
El Capitan (latest OSX) features a custom full screen feature where you can run two applications at the same time in a split split full screen mode.

Godot Editor does not support this because it does or cannot reorganize the UI dynamically . All the components and the layout is fixed and stiff. It should squish itself as much as possible create a horizontally thinner more compact look instead. 

![screen shot 2016-01-13 at 8 01 41 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12294956/02bcaaf6-b9cc-11e5-9450-20faf0e4e889.png)
